page.title: 10Didbrook in 1950
page.content: {Didbrook}in 1950 was a thriving village whose inhabitants enjoyed 3 shops and a blacksmith. The shops comprised of a butcher, situated next to the school; the baker's shop where the bread and cakes were baked on the premises; and lastly Mrs. Innes' sweet shop. In the middle of Didbrook was the blacksmith who was much in demand from the surrounding farms. He also had a petrol pump which had a winding handle to dispense the petrol. Almost all the villagers were employed by the farms and{Stanway Estate,}but the railway was also a major employer, thereby keeping village life very close. Transport was provided by trains and a local coach company, Harrisons, who provided a bus service on a Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday.
